Mr. Frank E. Schooley, President
national Association of Educational
Broadcasters
lit Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Franks
Thank you for your speech comment on the JCET deal with Old Dominion.
Your reaction is the same as my own, and the project is not one which
would justify a protest from either NAEB or the Center. I had approved
the approach to the Foundation by telephone and was given some assurance
at the time that the request would be granted.
As to JCET operating in pilot-study areas only, if the organization is
able to get money, it will go into program production, on whatever level
possible and there will be only one vote in the organization against
such a move.
Unless NAEB can secure special grants to underwrite, or produce directly,
TV programs in some special category which might be approved by the
Center, thereby staking out that field in effect, JCET can be expected
to continue to try to get into the actual production for distribution
business. Only a weakening of support, to the extent of reducing the
organization to a shoe string operation, will keep Dave and Ralph from
hinting up every foundation in the country for money for production but
we can talk about that later.
If you have not already done so, I suggest that you notify Newburn of
the change in the personnel of the Advisory Committee to the President
of the Center, including the change in chairmanship. Then, I think you
should request a meeting of the advisory Committee with Newburn to discuss
several things, including;
1. Assessment fee rate.
2. Fuller utilization of the Advisory Committee or other
committees in determining Center program policies and
program selection.
3. Coordination of information channels between NAEB and
the Center.
